title: OrgMaster

ns1:BannerType.description: Defines Banner and related information. Banner is the marketing identifer in a particular georgraphic area of the division or region.

ns1:ParentBannerCd.description: some of the banners are grouped under a parent banner like Safeway or Albertsons.

ns1:CompanyType.description: An accounting Organization which consists of an entire company within some legal framework.

ns1:AccountingPeriodsNbr.description: The number of periods for a company Accounting Periods     fiscal year. Valid values are 1 - 13.

ns1:AccountingUnitTxt.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:ActiveStatusCd.description: the active status is used to display the development status of a company. D=Delete, L=Live, T=Test, C=Consolidation and E=Elimination.

ns1:ChartNm.description: Name assigned to the chart of accounts of company structure.

ns1:CompanyDecimalPositionNbr.description: Number of decimal positions in the company currency code amount fields.

ns1:CompanyId.description: The number that identifies a company. A company represents a business or legal  entity of an organization.

ns1:CompanyNm.description: This is the company name or description.

ns1:ControlCodeUseInd.description: Indicates whether control totals are required for journal entries.

ns1:CurrencyCd.description: This is the company base currency code.

ns1:CurrencyTableNm.description: Currency table name. Currency tables are assigned to companies and define currency exchange and translation information.

ns1:CurrencyTranslationInd.description: Used to control currency translation processing.

ns1:FiscalYr.description: Contains the fiscal year for the data stored.

ns1:InterzoneBalancingInd.description: Indicates whether interzone balancing is used.

ns1:LevelDepthVal.description: Number of level defined for the company.

items.description: Level description occurs five times.
Number of digits for each level.

ns1:CorporationType.description: An Internal Organization which consists of an entire company within some legal framework.  For example, for Safeway, there are 2 Corporations, one for the U.S. and one for Canada.

ns1:DepartmentType.description: Defines a subdivision of the organization.  It is a part of a larger organization with a specific responsibility.  Specialized functional area within an organization or division such as accounting, marketing, planning.  Every department has its own manager and chain of command. Its main functions are accounting, marketing, planning, inventory, management.  Sales are also identified by department.

ns1:DepartmentId.description: Defines a Cd that uniquely identifies the departments based on its function.

ns1:DepartmentNm.description: Defines the name of the department.

ns1:DepartmentTypeCd.description: Defines a Cd that uniquely identifies the grouping of departments based on its function.

ns1:DistrictType.description: A district is a group of facilities.    A group of warehouse facilities may also be referred to as a distribution    center.

ns1:AltCorporationId.description: Corporation Id. Cross reference. This could be from ERP (SSIMS) system or others.

ns1:AltDistrictId.description: Alternate District Id from ERP (SSIMS) or other source.

ns1:AltDivisionId.description: Division Id. Cross reference. This could be from ERP (SSIMS) system or others.

ns1:DistrictCd.description: Identifies a district. It is a legacy data used in some applications.

ns1:DivisionType.description: A subset of corporation which has its own general ledger. It is manageable and supports one type of business. A logical segment representing a specific business function with a definite place on the organizational chart.

ns1:AccountingUnitNm.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:BusinessTypeCd.description: Defines the type of business to which the Division belongs to.ex: Sales, Supply chain, administrative.

ns1:DivisionId.description: Identifies the division that is subset of a corporation and responsible for a certain type of line of business.

ns1:DivisionNm.description: Name of the Safeway Divisionex: Norcal, Denver, Dominick's, Supply, Safeway Direct.

ns1:DivisionWithTypeType.description: Provides Division information with additional details about type of hierarchy it represents.

ns1:AccountingUnitNm.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:BusinessTypeCd.description: Defines the type of business to which the Division belongs to.ex: Sales, Supply chain, administrative.

ns1:DivisionId.description: Identifies the division that is subset of a corporation and responsible for a certain type of line of business.

ns1:DivisionNm.description: Name of the Safeway Divisionex: Norcal, Denver, Dominick's, Supply, Safeway Direct.

ns1:FacilityDepartmentSectionType.description: Defines various sections within a department of a facility.A facility is physically divided into different departments and sections.Ex:Grocery department can have sections like Grocery main meal,Snacks,Family care grocery,Home care grocery,Soft Drinks,Candy,Meals ingredients.

ns1:AccountingUnitNm.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:DepartmentId.description: Defines a Cd that uniquely identifies the departments based on its function.

ns1:FirstEffectiveDt.description: The first Dt on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, First Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the First Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 01/01/0001 or the lowest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:LastEffectiveDt.description: The last Dt on which a condition or a version of an object was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, Last Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the Last Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 12/31/9999 or the highest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:FacilityDepartmentType.description: Defines various departments in a facility.

ns1:AccountingUnitNm.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:AddressLineTxt.description: Sometimes departments like Fuel station may have different street address from store street address.

ns1:FirstEffectiveDt.description: The first Dt on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, First Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the First Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 01/01/0001 or the lowest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:LastEffectiveDt.description: The last Dt on which a condition or a version of an object was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, Last Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the Last Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 12/31/9999 or the highest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:FacilityType.description: Contains data related to a facility like type, id, name.

items.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.
The organizational name of the company from which this facility was acquired.
Alternate facility identifier, generally store nbr in char format.
This  field  contains  the authorized headcount    for  a  facility or department.  This value may   be  used  to  estimate the number of time cards  which may be expected per week.
Date on which the store facility is converted into ABS/Swy systems.
Indicates if the store facility is converted into ABS/SWY systems.
Total Display area in SFT
Total store area in SFT
Defines the Cd that uniquely identifies a brand of store.For example :B-BON APPETIT C-CARRS D-DOMINICKS E-EAGLE F-RANDALLS FLAGSHIPetc.
Date on which the public Notified that the store will be closed.

Defines the Cd that uniquely identifies a store current status.  A store can be :       Open to Public      ;      Closed              ;      Active               ;      Inactive            ;      Temporarily Closed  ;      Never Active

A four character code that is used with corporation
 and division to uniquely identify a facility. A facility may "belong" to
 only one corporation and one division. A building may house one or more
facilities. There are two categories for facilities:
 1) Operating facility
 - actively supports the business of the Company
 - is a distinct business operation within a building
  - examples: office, processing plant, retail store, truck service
 shop, or warehouse building  (A warehouse facility includes all warehouse departments that exist within a single building.)
 - each type of division/business has a different set of possible types of operating facilities: i.e.,
 - Retail: retail outlets and offices.
- Wholesale: warehouse facilities, truck service shop, and offices.
- Processing/Manufacturing: processing plants and offices.
 2) Non-operating Facility                                                     
 - not currently being operated by the Company.
 - facilities
Name of the facility. ex Tracy DC or Safeway store in Bollinger Canyon San Ramon
Type of the facility like, DC,  warehouse, Retail Store, Office building, manufacturing plant..etc.
Indicates if the third party financial services like bank are available in the store.
First Effective Date.
Last Effective Date.
This is the level description.
The federal Milk Marketing Board divides the country into milk marketing areas;. Each store is assigned to an area.   Milk sales/prices are reported to the government by area.
Store orders processing to whse/dsd end date.Degfault value 999-12-31.
Store orders processing to whse/dsd start date.
This is the end date for a temporary stop on store orders.That means the store orders will resume from the next day.
Stores may need to temporarily stop the orders to warehouse or DSD for a business reasons.This is the date when store orders were stopped temporarly.
Nbr of parking spaces.

This field contains a code which uniquely identifies a payroll unit.   A  payroll unit is a group of facilities having  the same payroll processing responsibility area.  Payroll  units  may  have  facilities from more  than  one  division or corporation.  A division  may have more than one payroll unit.
Captures the facility id changes. Represents replaced Corp Id of the replaced facility.
Captures the facility id changes. Represents replaced Division Id of the replaced facility.
Captures the facility id changes. Represents replaced facility.
TotalSales Area in SFT

This field contains a code to uniquely identify a  Safeway Employees Association Section,    within a Safeway division.   Each Safeway office employs an S.E.A. secretary.  The  secretary  is  responsible  for facilities  within  the division area, including facilities   from other divisions and corporations.   The  group  of  facilities is made more  managable by dividing them into S.E.A. sections,  usually based on smaller geographic areas.
Safeway  Employees  Association Sub-section,  within S.E.A. Section and Safeway division.
End Date for store temporary close.
Date on which the store has been closed temporarily for upgrades or any other reasons.

A unique four digit code that identifies a Tier Company. A TIER company is a legal tax entity established during the 1986 LBO and dissolving of Safeway Stores, Inc.  These companies are still on-going legal entities.
This yes/no switch indicates if the facility uses an  automated time and attendance system.                  Possible values are: Y - yes, has automated system, or N - no.

This field indicates the format of time information which is submitted to the payroll head office by the     facility. Possible values are H, for hours and minutes, or D, for times as decimal numbers.

ns1:AcquiredFromNm.description: The organizational name of the company from which this facility was acquired.

ns1:AltPlantId.description: Alternate plant identifier, generally Plant nbr in char format.

ns1:AuthorizedHeadCountNbr.description: This  field  contains  the authorized headcount    for  a  facility or department.  This value may   be  used  to  estimate the number of time cards  which may be expected per week.

ns1:CloseAnnouncedDt.description: Date on which the public Notified that the plant will be closed.

ns1:ConversionDt.description: Date on which the store facility is converted into ABS/Swy systems.

ns1:ConversionInd.description: Indicates if the store facility is converted into ABS/SWY systems.

ns1:CurrentStatusCd.description: Defines the Cd that uniquely identifies a plant current status.  A plant can be :       Open    ;      Closed              ;      Active               ;      Inactive            ;      Temporarily Closed  ;      Never Active

ns1:DUNsNbr.description: Dun and Broadstreet identifier issued to the plant as unique identifier.

ns1:DockingStationCnt.description: Docking station count Nbr for plant trucks.

ns1:OtherSystemPlantNbr.description: Store number in other system like acquired from company system.

ns1:PayrollUnitCd.description: This field contains a code which uniquely identifies a payroll unit.   A  payroll unit is a group of facilities having  the same payroll processing responsibility area.  Payroll  units  may  have  facilities from more  than  one  division or corporation.  A division  may have more than one payroll unit.

ns1:PlantType.description: Identifies the type of the plant like milk plant or bread plant.

ns1:ReplacedCorporationId.description: Captures the store id changes. Represents replaced Corp Id of the replaced store.

ns1:ReplacedDivisionId.description: Captures the store id changes. Represents replaced Division Id of the replaced store.

ns1:ReplacedPlantId.description: Captures the plant id changes. Represents replaced plant.

ns1:SpecialFeaturesCd.description: Contains Cds for all special fetaures in the store.Concatnated value of different Cds.

ns1:TempCloseEndDt.description: End Date for plant temporary close.

ns1:TempCloseStartDt.description: Date on which the plant has been closed temporarily for upgrades or any other reasons.

ns1:TierCompanyCd.description:
A unique four digit code that identifies a Tier Company.              
A TIER company is a legal tax entity established during the 1986 LBO  
and dissolving of Safeway Stores, Inc.  These companies are still     
on-going legal entities.

ns1:TimeAndAttendanceSystemInd.description: This yes/no switch indicates if the facility uses an  automated time and attendance system.                  Possible values are: Y - yes, has automated system, or N - no.

ns1:TimeClockFormatCd.description: This field indicates the format of time information which is submitted to the payroll head office by the     facility. Possible values are H, for hours and minutes, or D, for times as decimal numbers.

ns1:UpgradeClassCd.description: This code identifies the physical status of a  facility.  The code is used to estimate what is required to upgrade the facility to modern   ; standards.

ns1:OperatingAreaType.description: Defines a point of accountability and is a subset of division. Operating areas never span divisions. The function of Operating Area is primarily Distribution and Manufacturing.  It is a consolidation of Districts.As is process as of 4/30/08:  In US, all Retail is rolled up into US Accounting Division 17.  Each operating area is a division—US accounting division is 17.  In US Supply, NorCal has three (3) operating areas, each has 5-6 districts.  1) In Supply, Division 55 is split into Safeway S Brands and ConsoliDtd Procurement2) Can report on a single operating area where organization matches.  Or can report on the Corp Account (Division 17).Currently, Safeway has 12 Retail Operating Areas.

ns1:AltCorporationId.description: Corporation Id. Cross reference. This could be from ERP (SSIMS) system or others.

ns1:AltDivisionId.description: Division Id. Cross reference. This could be from ERP (SSIMS) system or others.

ns1:AltOperatingAreaId.description: Alternate Operating Ared Id. Cross reference. This could be from ERP (SSIMS) system or others.

ns1:OrderFacilityType.description: Order Fullfilling facility -Defines all the facilities from where items can be ordered in the Merchandising systems. It includes warehouses and supply facilities but does not include Independent sales facilities. For each ordering facility the table contains the operating facility Nbr from OMOPFAC. This column is used to join SSORDFAC and OMOPFAC and retrieve information about the physical facility using the ordering facility Nbr. This standard join is called SSOPFAC.

ns1:APCreateInmtchInd.description: Switch used to determine if WMD580 should create APINMTCH (APPO / APINV) records.

ns1:AdjustmentReasonCd.description: The reason an adjustment is made.

ns1:AllowanceBillingBuyerNbr.description: Identifies the allowance billing buyer Nbr. SSORDFAC.ALLOWBILLNUM. Default allowance billing buyer Nbr for this facility. This buyer Nbr initially receives all internal deal bouncers for this facility. It is also the default recepient for external bouncers sent to the allowance billing department for this facility. APPO.ALLOWBILLNUM. Allowance billing buyer Nbr currently associated with this purchase order.

ns1:AppointmentPhoneNbr.description: The phone Nbr for the freight companies to call the warehouse to schedule a delivery appointment. This will also be used to print on purchase orders.

ns1:AverageCostInd.description: An Ind of whether the cost is being averaged.

ns1:AverageCostTolerancePercentage.description: Average Cost Percent Tolerance allowed between the old and new item average costs. If their differences exceed the tolerance level their values are written to a new record on the WMAVCEXP table. It is used for either vendor or inventory average costs.

ns1:BouncerFacilityInd.description: Switch used to determine if purchase orders can be bounced (POBNCR record created) when the minimum bouncer Amt is exceeded.

ns1:BrokerageGoodsAndServicesTaxAdjReaso.description: This is the reason Cd that will be assigned to the booking (WMWIMSJE record) if the GST falls withing the tolerance for Brokerage Invoices.

ns1:DiscountToleranceDays.description: The Nbr of days for the discount tolerance.

ns1:DiscountTolerancePercentage.description: The percentage discount for the tolerance.

ns1:FreightAdjustmentReasonTypeCd.description: The type of adjustment reason for this freight.

ns1:FreightGoodsAndServicesTaxAdjReasonC.description: This is the reason Cd that will be assigned to the booking (WMWIMSJE record) if the GST falls within the tolerance for Freight Invoices.

ns1:GoodsAndServicesTaxToleranceAmt.description: This is the Amt to be used to determine if the GST difference (invoice to purchase order) is within the acceptable tolerance limit.

ns1:InventoryDiscountToleranceDays.description: The Nbr of days for the inventory discount tolerance.

ns1:MaximumAutocostBouncerAmt.description: Maximum dollar Amt (for auto costed items), when exceeded causes an Internal bouncer to be produced. These internal bouncers have no affect upon P/O - Invoice payments.

ns1:MaximumManualBouncerAmt.description: Maximum dollar Amt, when exceeded, will cause an External bouncer to be created (auto generated via WMD580). This is assuming the BOUNCEFACSW is set on.

ns1:MaximumSPACOBouncerAmt.description: Maximum dollar Amt (for specific P/Os where auto costing has been turned off), when exceeded, causes an External bouncer to be created.

ns1:MinimumAutocostBouncerAmt.description: Minimum dollar Amt (for auto costed items), when exceeded causes an Internal bouncer to be created. These internal bouncers will not hold up P/O - Invoice payment.

ns1:MinimumManualBouncerAmt.description: Minimum dollar Amt, when exceeded will cause an External bouncer to be produced. This is assuming the BOUNCEFACSW is set on.

ns1:MinimumSPACOBouncerAmt.description: Minimum dollar Amt (for specific P/Os where auto costing has been turned off), when exceeded, causes an external bouncer to be created.

ns1:NetToleranceDays.description: The Nbr of days for the net tolerance.

items.description: Generic type to capture different org structures.

ns1:OverrideCashDiscountInd.description: Determines if CASH DISCOUNT and DUE DATE may be overridden on warehouse payable purchase orders.

ns1:ProductGoodsAndServicesTaxAdjReasonC.description: This is the reason Cd that will be assigned to the booking (WMWIMSJE record) if the GST falls within the tolerance for Vendor Product Invoices for the product.

ns1:SectionLicenseId.description: A new California Cigarette and Tobacco Products Licensing Act of 2003 law requires licensing and new record keeping requirements for selling Cigarette And Tobacco products in California retail stores and distribution centers.  The LICENSEID column is generic so that other sections requiring a license such as liquor can use it.  SSORDFAC - This is the License id for the warehouse. It will contain the Tobacco license Nbr required to distribute cigarette and tobacco products from the tobacco warehouse.  OMFDSEC - This is a license id for a facility section. It will contain the Tobacco license Nbr required for the stores to sell tobacco products and cigarettes.

ns1:TrafficBuyerNbr.description: Identifies the traffic coordinator buyer Nbr. SSORDFAC.TRAFFICNUM. Default traffic coordinator buyer Nbr for this facility. This buyer Nbr initially receives all internal freight bouncers for this facility. It is also the default recepient for all external bouncers sent to the traffic department for this facility. APPO.TRAFFICNUM. Traffic coordinator buyer Nbr currently associated with this purchase order.

ns1:OrgMasterNameType.description: Generic name type that can be used to capture Name of the any entity within a organization structure

ns1:OrgEntityNm.description: Name of the org entity. Ex div name, section name, dept name.

ns1:OrgEntityType.description: Type of the org entity, like dept, section, div,store..etc

ns1:OrgEntityValue.description: Id for the org entity ex, div id, dept id, store id etc.

ns1:PlantDepartmentHourType.description: Maintains working hours of the plant Department by week day

ns1:CloseHr.description: Defines the ending hour of the facility operation.

ns1:OpenHr.description: Defines the starting hour of the facility operation.

ns1:PlantDepartmentId.description: Identifies the department within plant facility.

ns1:WeekDay.description: Determines the day of the week (Monday, Tuesday, etc.)

ns1:PlantDepartmentType.description: Defines various departments in a manufacturing plant

ns1:AddressLineTxt.description: Sometimes departments like Fuel station may have different street address from store street address.

ns1:FirstEffectiveDt.description: The first Dt on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, First Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the First Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 01/01/0001 or the lowest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:LastEffectiveDt.description: The last Dt on which a condition or a version of an object was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, Last Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the Last Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 12/31/9999 or the highest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:PlantHourType.description: Maintains working hours of the plant by week day.

ns1:CloseHr.description: Defines the ending hour of the facility operation.

ns1:OpenHr.description: Defines the starting hour of the facility operation.

ns1:WeekDay.description: Determines the day of the week (Monday, Tuesday, etc.)

ns1:RegionType.description: Region is a group of Divisions within a Corporation.

ns1:RetailOrderGroupType.description: Retail Ordering Group (ROG) identifies the grouping of stores that order all their items from the same set of warehouses, and are in the same retail division. It must belong to one and only one Division. This information is important for determining Source of Supply (eg. where does store or warehouse get their product from) and cost of goods and translates into demand for Procurement to purchase/replenish product for the stores' demands. It only applies to Supply Chain (and not Retail). ROG is sometimes created to support different Advertising or Promotional needs.  For example,  PKSV  -  Pak N? Save is supplied by the same warehouses as SNCA (Safeway Norcal) but different     Promotional programs.  This is recently changing so that PKSV needs to be merged with SNCA since the Norcal Division is     going re-brand Pak N? Save ? Safeway stores.ROG is sometimes also created to support different Distribuition Centers within a Division or different sources of supply       *   If Distribution Centres close or source of supply is consoliDtd or standardized, some ROG?s become redundant.           For example, SALK (Safeway Alaska) previously supplied from Seattle, SACG (Safeway Alaska Carr Gottstein)           supplied from Anchorage, now both SALK & SACG are sourced from the same set-up warerhouses.  Stores in ROG SALK           can be merged into SACG, since source of supply is now the same.  There is also the unconventional ROG?s that have been used to identify Source of Supply for products for the Norcal ?Citrine Bistro? Restaurant, for Lucerne outside customers from regional Safeway DC?s, and a ?virtual? Dot Com ROG to support Source of Supply for specific seasonal merchandise.         For example,        RNCA    CA   RESTAURANT NORCAL                     LUAK    AK   LUCERNE SALES WANC                    LUCN    CA   LUCERNE SALES NCAL                    LUDL    TX   LUCERNE SALES WDAL

ns1:RogId.description: Retail Ordering Group (ROG) identifies the grouping of stores that order all their items from the same set of warehouses, and are in the same retail division. It must belong to one and only one Division.

ns1:RogRankNbr.description: Ranking Nbr of the ROG with in a Division based on Sales.

ns1:RetailStoreGroup.description: Group of stores defined by a particular type, Ex Ad group, Promo group, ROG..etc.

ns1:StoreGroupTypeNm.description: Type of the store group like retail order group, promo group..etc

ns1:RetailStoreHourType.description: Maintains working hours of the store by week day.

ns1:CloseHr.description: Defines the ending hour of the facility operation.

ns1:OpenHr.description: Defines the starting hour of the facility operation.

ns1:WeekDay.description: Determines the day of the week (Monday, Tuesday, etc.)

ns1:RetailStoreType.description: Defines a facility with a large range of goods offered at retail prices, and which provides advice and detailed information on goods sold.

ns1:AccountingUnitNm.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:AcquiredFromNm.description: The organizational name of the company from which this facility was acquired.

ns1:AltStoreId.description: Alternate store identifier, generally store nbr in char format.

ns1:AuthorizedHeadCountNbr.description: This  field  contains  the authorized headcount    for  a  facility or department.  This value may   be  used  to  estimate the number of time cards  which may be expected per week.

ns1:ConversionDt.description: Date on which the store facility is converted into ABS/Swy systems.

ns1:ConversionInd.description: Indicates if the store facility is converted into ABS/SWY systems.

ns1:FinancialServicesInd.description: Indicates if the third party financial services like bank are available in the store.

ns1:FuelRackCd.description: Fuel rack number to which the retail store fuel station belongs to.

ns1:HomeDeliveryInd.description: Indicates if the store is enabled for grocery home delivery by eCom.

ns1:MilkAreaCd.description: The  federal Milk Marketing Board divides the country into "milk marketing areas". Each store is assigned to an area.   Milk sales/prices are reported to the government by area.

ns1:OrderEndDt.description: Store orders processing to whse/dsd end date.Degfault value 999-12-31.

ns1:OrderStartDt.description: Store orders processing to whse/dsd start date.

ns1:OrderTempStopEndDt.description: This is the end date for a temporary stop on store orders.That means the store orders will resume from the next day.

ns1:OrderTempStopStartDt.description: Stores may need to temporarily stop the orders to warehouse or DSD for a business reasons.This is the date when store orders were stopped temporarly.

ns1:OtherSystemStoreNbr.description: Store number in other system like acquired from company system.

ns1:PayrollUnitCd.description: This field contains a code which uniquely identifies a payroll unit.   A  payroll unit is a group of facilities having  the same payroll processing responsibility area.  Payroll  units  may  have  facilities from more  than  one  division or corporation.  A division  may have more than one payroll unit.

ns1:ReplacedCorporationId.description: Captures the store id changes. Represents replaced Corp Id of the replaced store.

ns1:ReplacedDivisionId.description: Captures the store id changes. Represents replaced Division Id of the replaced store.

ns1:ReplacedStoreId.description: Captures the store id changes. Represents replaced store.

ns1:RetailFacilityTypeCd.description: Defines the classifying attribute for a retail facility.  This could be store, fuel station, restaurant or stand alone pharmacy.

ns1:SeaSectionCd.description: This field contains a code to uniquely identify a  Safeway Employees Association Section,    within a Safeway division.   Each Safeway office employs an S.E.A. secretary.  The  secretary  is  responsible  for facilities  within  the division area, including facilities   from other divisions and corporations.   The  group  of  facilities is made more  managable by dividing them into S.E.A. sections,  usually based on smaller geographic areas.

ns1:SeaSubsectionCd.description: Safeway  Employees  Association Sub-section,  within S.E.A. Section and Safeway division.

ns1:SpecialFeaturesCd.description: Contains Cds for all special fetaures in the store.Concatnated value of different Cds.

ns1:StoreBannerCd.description: Defines the Cd that uniquely identifies a brand of store.For example :B -  BON APPETIT     C -  CARRS          D -  DOMINICKS      E -  EAGLE          F -  RANDALLS FLAGSHIPetc.

ns1:StoreCloseAnnouncedDt.description: Date on which the public Notified that the store will be closed.

ns1:StoreCurrentStatusCd.description: Defines the Cd that uniquely identifies a store current status.  A store can be :       Open to Public      ;      Closed              ;      Active               ;      Inactive            ;      Temporarily Closed  ;      Never Active

ns1:TempCloseEndDt.description: End Date for store temporary close.

ns1:TempCloseStartDt.description: Date on which the store has been closed temporarily for upgrades or any other reasons.

ns1:TierCompanyCd.description:
A unique four digit code that identifies a Tier Company.              
A TIER company is a legal tax entity established during the 1986 LBO  
and dissolving of Safeway Stores, Inc.  These companies are still     
on-going legal entities.

ns1:TimeAndAttendanceSystemInd.description: This yes/no switch indicates if the facility uses an  automated time and attendance system.                  Possible values are: Y - yes, has automated system, or N - no.

ns1:TimeClockFormatCd.description: This field indicates the format of time information which is submitted to the payroll head office by the     facility. Possible values are H, for hours and minutes, or D, for times as decimal numbers.

ns1:UpgradeClassCd.description: This code identifies the physical status of a  facility.  The code is used to estimate what is required to upgrade the facility to modern   ; standards.

ns1:SectionType.description: Defines grouping of products or services within a department.

ns1:BusinessUnitCd.description: Defines the Cd that uniquely identifies a Business Unit.Sample Business Unit are :MeatLiquor & TobaccoDairy & Refrigerationetc.

ns1:PriceArea.description: Price areas are groups of stores within a ROG that have the same Pricing structure.  Price areas are maintained at facility section level in SSPAFACL_TABLE.

ns1:SectionCd.description: Defines the Cd that uniquely identified the  grouping of products or services within a department.

ns1:SectionNm.description: Defines the name of the section.

ns1:SectionTypeCd.description: Defines the Cd that uniquely identifies the different types of sections for a department. For example, backstage, retail, processing and warehouse.

ns1:StoreCheckStandType.description: Captures information about various types of check stands available within the store.Ex: regular, Remote, Express, Self..etc

ns1:CheckStandTypeCd.description: Identifies the type of check standex: Regular, Remote, Express, Self.

ns1:StoreDepartmentHourType.description: Maintains working hours of the store Department by week day.Ex: Pharmacy working hours, Deli working hours etc.

ns1:CloseHr.description: Defines the ending hour of the facility operation.

ns1:OpenHr.description: Defines the starting hour of the facility operation.

ns1:StoreDepartmentId.description: Identifies the Retail department within retail store facility.

ns1:WeekDay.description: Determines the day of the week (Monday, Tuesday, etc.)

ns1:StoreDepartmentSectionType.description: Defines various sections within a department of  a retail store facility.A store facility is physically divided into different departments and sections.Ex:Grocery department can have sections like Grocery main meal,Snacks,Family care grocery,Home care grocery,Soft Drinks,Candy,Meals ingredients.

ns1:AccountingUnitNm.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:DepartmentId.description: Defines a Cd that uniquely identifies the departments based on its function.

ns1:FirstEffectiveDt.description: The first Dt on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, First Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the First Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 01/01/0001 or the lowest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:LastEffectiveDt.description: The last Dt on which a condition or a version of an object was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, Last Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the Last Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 12/31/9999 or the highest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:StoreDepartmentType.description: Defines various departments in a retail store.

ns1:AccountingUnitNm.description: The accounting unit name which is a unique location within the company.

ns1:AddressLineTxt.description: Sometimes departments like Fuel station may have different street address from store street address.

ns1:FirstEffectiveDt.description: The first Dt on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, First Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the First Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 01/01/0001 or the lowest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:LastEffectiveDt.description: The last Dt on which a condition or a version of an object was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, Last Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the Last Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 12/31/9999 or the highest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

ns1:WarehouseType.description: Defines Warehouse facilities from where goods can be shiiped to and from.  contains information for WIMS, CRIB, EXPRES and other systems. Facility may relate to a Warehouse Depts in a Distribution Centre .

ns1:AccumulatedShipTodayInd.description: Used to indicate if today shipped fields should be cleared or accumulated for the this warehouse. This determines whether SSD009 will zero out the 'Shipped Today' field. If Independent order (IND050) are run before Safeway orders then SSD009 should not set the 'Shipped Today' field to zero. In this case the Ind value will be N. This Ind is normally set to Y.

ns1:AllowRushOrderInd.description: The Ind to show if a warehouse is allow rush order.

ns1:AutoServiceLevelInd.description: This switch controls whether auto service level calculations are done for the warehouse. If set to Y a review is done on every valid WIMS item on the master DB2 table to determine if a service level change is required. This process automatically maintains the item service level based on the items current contribution to the total warehouse cost of the shipments.

ns1:BETAFactor.description: A factor used in calculating the variability in the MAD over a time interval. Used by WMW740. Default value is 9.90.

ns1:BeginningBalanceOnhandCalculationInd.description: NOTE: This column is currently NOT USED! Beginning Balance On-Hand Calculation Switch. To indicate whether or not a clean BOH snapshot of the warehouse can be taken at the beginning of the business day (normally midnight local time). Ie. if not, the value for this field will be Y, and if so (ie. scheduled activity such as BOMBs, Rec.s, Adj.s, taking place at this time), the value will be N or .

ns1:BillAllAdInd.description: This switch is used to allow Ad items to go negative in stock. ie: Min < 0. Bill all ad items even if no stock.

ns1:BillAllSelectionListInd.description: This switch is used to control whether or not to BILL ALL on seperate selection lists. ie: Firm orders Bill all means that the quantities will be allowed to go negative (< 0) for those items.

ns1:BillAllWarehouseInd.description: Used to indicate if warehouse orders are to be filled without regard to stock count. Bill All Warehouses will 'bill past zero' or allow on-hand to go to a negative figure. Y = bill all warehouse. N = bill to zero warehouse.

ns1:CalmMachineTypeCd.description: On the WMFACOPT table this is the machine type for calm for a retail order. On the EXWKAHED table this is the machine type used for calm. It could be for the retail or Independence order

ns1:CarrierEquipmentTypeCd.description: This is the carrier equipment type Cd that identifies the type of equipment a carrier must use for delivering products to specific warehouse receiving facilities.

ns1:CaseCubePrintInd.description: This switch is used to indicate if the total case cube is to be printed on the purchase orders.

ns1:CasesThresholdInd.description: This field is used by program EXC021 and controls whether added piece counts from the EXPRES Order Header are checked in Units (U) or by Percentage (P).

ns1:CasesThresholdNbr.description: This is the value that the Added Piece count from the EXPRES order header is tested against to decide whether the added piece count will create a positive or negative change to an order. Program EXC021 uses this field.

ns1:CribOverstockFactor.description: Used in CRW370 to suppress the reporting of O/S where the O/S on-hand is less than the SSV1

ns1:CribReviewDays.description: The CRIB system calculates a review period and evaluates forthcoming deals or cost changes in the review period. The review period is calculated as todays date + CRBREVIEWDAYS. CRW300 and CRW330 will set this value to 21 days if it has not been preset by the buyer.

ns1:CribWarehouseAreaCd.description: Grouping of warehouses used by the CRIB system.

ns1:CribWarehouseInd.description: Warehouse Nbr used by the CRIB System.

ns1:CubeThresholdInd.description: This field is used by program EXC021 and controls whether added cubes from the EXPRES Order Header are checked in Units (U) or by Percentage (P).

ns1:CubeThresholdNbr.description: This is the value that the Added Cubes from the EXPRES order header is tested against to decide whether the added cubes will create a positive or negative change to an order. Program EXC021 uses this field.

ns1:CubingPageBreakInd.description: This option allows the user to request page breaks after each cube. (used in program EXC046). IF the CALM system is used for this warehouse (WRKASMTSELSW or WRKASMTLTDSW = Y) then this swith must be set to Y

ns1:CurrentWeekAdjustmentFactor.description: Sales adjustment factor for current week.Allows the forcast and MAD to be adjusted. Used when the delivery date falls within this week. This us used by WMD510. The default value is 1.0. It is set by the Merchandising Department Manager.

ns1:CustomsBrokageAmt.description: A flat dollar Amt (fee) entered onto the purchase order. Customs brokerage is incurred at the time a shipment of goods is inspected by customs.

ns1:DataExtractInd.description: This is a switch which indicates whether or not the associated record is being extracted for the U.S. Warehousing.

ns1:DealRetentionDays.description: The Nbr of days that expired deal rows will remain on VENALL before they are deleted by WMD500. Set by the Merchandising Department Manager.

ns1:DefaultSelectedItemCd.description: The default value of SELITEMCD. This value is used in MEC040 instead of the hardCdd value determined from CONATION.

ns1:DefaultWarehouseItemInd.description: The Ind to show either the Mcl/Br (Mcdonolds Consolidated Branch) Item Cd or Warehouse Item ID on the screen.

ns1:DelayDays.description: The Nbr of days a vendor can be late on delivery after his due date. This is used to calculate safety stock.

ns1:DemandFilterCnt.description: Nbr of continuous weeks there has been a demand filter trip. A demand filter trip is when the variation between actual and forecast demand falls outside specified limits. The SSV1 is not recalculated. This field is used by WMW740. The default value is 9.

ns1:DepartmentBillingFacilityInd.description: A switch of whether the facility is a department billing facility.

ns1:DoubleSpaceNewAisleInd.description: This option allows the user to request a double space on the selection list when the first two digits (aisle) of the slot Cd changes.

ns1:ESOAmt.description: The calculation estimate stockout (ESO) is compared against the value by WIMS SVA routine. If the ESO is greater, the item is flagged and printed on the SVA report.

ns1:ESOTimeLimitNbr.description: The calculation estimate stockout (ESO) is compared against the value by WIMS SVA routine. If the ESO is greater, the item is flagged and printed on the SVA report.

ns1:EqualPackSizeConversionInd.description: Used to indicate type of item to convert for equal pack size Conversion.

ns1:EqualPackSizeConversionTypeCd.description: Used to indicate the type of Equal Pack Size Conversion.

ns1:EqualPackSizeInd.description: Used to indicate if an order size conversion for SUB/ALT items is to be performed for this warehouse. For each warehouse, options may be specified to indicate what kind of order-size conversion should be performed on the Substitute and Alternate item. If there is going to be a conversion on the order and size on the SUB/ALT item for a warehouse then this Ind must be set to Y. Example: a store orders 5 cases of 24 cans of 341 ml beans. Instead they are given a sub or alt of 12 cans of 341 ml beans. If the equal pack size Ind is on, the Qty of the store order will be converted from 5 cases of 24 to 10 cases of 12.

ns1:FederalTaxId.description: The federal tax Id associated with this distribution center.

ns1:FirmOrderShipInd.description: This Ind is used for Firm Order processing where the Firm Order item is out of stock. The Ind is checked and the firm order is filled with a Sub/Alt item or not filled at all. (used in program EXC545)

ns1:GenerateBranchItemCd.description: This column will tell MEC040 if it should automatically generate branch item Cds when setting up new SSITMWDS records.

ns1:GenerateShippingDockInd.description: When this switch is set, full pallet orders will be filled by shipping dock moves. Shipping dock moves are similar to letdowns with the exception that letdowns go into a pick slot while shipping dock moves go into the shipping dock.

ns1:GenerateWarehouseItemIdInd.description: Indicates if a WHITEMID (warehouse item) should be generated when an SSITMWDS row is created. (Y : to generate a Cd that is unique within Distribution Centre. )

ns1:GreaterSmoothingFactor.description: A greater smoothin factor that is used when the SSV1 cannot keep up with the change in demand. The default fast smoothing on SSITMWDS is zero. This field is used by WMW740 and the default value is 0.30.

ns1:IndependentsFoShipInd.description: This Ind is used for Firm Order processing where the Firm Order item is out of stock. The Ind is checked and the firm order is filled with a Sub/Alt item or not filled at all. This Ind is used for Independent FOs. (used in program EXC545)

ns1:IndependentsLetdownAisleBreakInd.description: This option allows the user to request page breaks when there is a new aisle as opposed to the default of breaking by section. Program EXC047 uses this field.

ns1:IndependentsLetdownManualPrintInd.description: This switch, when set to Y, allows the warehouse to print their letdowns manually. The letdowns will accumulate into one file until the user manually releases them. All letdown since the last letdown will be accumulated/held. Manually releasing the letdowns is done with an option in the OLWS system.

ns1:IndependentsPrintInventoryCd.description: This switch is used to request printing the inventory Cds first on the report. ie: at the beginning of the report. This can be used for up to 10 different inventory Cds at a time. Program EXC046 uses this field.

ns1:IndependentsSelectionListByStoreInd.description: This switch is used to control whether the selection list is printed in Slot or Item order.

ns1:IndependentsSortFullPalletsInd.description: When this switch is set on, all full pallet orders for a warehouse will be sorted after the invalids for the warehouse on selection lists. This switch must be set to if the warehouse is using the CALM labor standards system (WRKASMTSELSW = Y). This switch also seems to be used to determine if an independent orders will follow the cube processing in the selection list print program (EXC046)

ns1:InventoryIBCostInd.description: An Ind used when pending cost records are created. It determines if the Inventory Cost that is calculated should moved to the Item Billing Cost. Any programs that create Pending Costs (SSPENCST records) must refer to this Ind to determine when to copy inventory cost into Item Billing cost. The Default is N. This is set by the Merchandising Department Manager.

ns1:InventoryMaintenanceRate.description: The inventory carring cost rate. Used by WMD510. Default is 0.200. Set by the Merchandising Department Manager.

ns1:InventoryProcessInd.description: This switch is used by program EXC545 to control whether or not to process the inventory group for the warehouse. If set to yes, then processing of the group takes place.

ns1:InventoryProcessWeekNbr.description: This is a week Nbr that the program EXC545 uses when processing an inventory groups orders to determine whether short quantities will be added to SSITMQTY ship week 1 column or the ship week 2 column. To be added to week 1 the week Nbr must match the Expres Order Header scheduled delivery week Nbr.

ns1:JEAdvanceDeclineInd.description: Indicates if PAF065 should generate Journal Entries to book Advances And Declines for the associated Facility.

ns1:LabelLaserInd.description: A switch (yes or ) to determine if DRS laser printing defaults rather than DRS impact printing defaults will be used for label printing

ns1:LayerLineCost.description: Used to control the Nbr of layers ordered when an item is ordered in layers. Used by WMD510. Default is 1.75. The Merchandising Department Manager set this value.

ns1:LayerRoundingLowerLimitNbr.description: If the fraction of the remaining layer is less than this value, then the order is rounded down to the Nbr of full layers.

ns1:LayerRoundingOptionInd.description: Used to indicate if Layer rounding is to be performed for this warehouse.

ns1:LayerRoundingUpperLimitNbr.description: If the fraction of the remaining layer is greater than this value, then the order is rounded up to the Nbr of full layers.

ns1:LeadTimeAdjustmentFactor.description: An additional factor that is used when calculating safety stock to allow for fluctuations in the lead time.

ns1:LeadWarehouseInd.description: Assign a lead warehouse within a division. This is to allow the billing department to identify Vendor to bill allowance to in case of multiple vendors supplying Safeway. This column will be maintained by IT.

ns1:LetdownManualPrintInd.description: This switch, when set to Y, allows the warehouse to print their letdowns manually. The letdowns will accumulate into one file until the user manually releases them. All letdown since the last letdown will be accumulated/held. Manually releasing the letdowns is done with an option in the OLWS system.

ns1:LotChangePercent.description: This tells the system to create a new lot is the cost change is greater that the specified percentage. This value is used is not found on SSITMWDS.

ns1:LotMaximumMarkdownAmt.description: This is the maximum dollar markdown that the system will take without creating a new lot for lot items. This value is used as a default if not found on SSITMWDS.

ns1:MADLowerLimitPercent.description:
The lowest value of MAD (Mean Absolute Deviation) that is used in the WIMS forcasting routine during the tracking signal and demand filter tests. The MAD is checked against this percentage of the SSV1.
 If it is lower, a new MAD is calculated by multiplying this figure times the SSV1. This field is used by WMW740 and the default value is 0.10.

ns1:MADUpperLimitPercent.description: The highest value of MAD that is used in the WIMS forcasting routine during the tracking signal and demand filter tests. The MAD ia checked against this percentage of the SSV1. If it is higher,a new MAD is calculated by multiplying this figure times the SSV1. This field is used by WMW740 and the default value is 0.10.

ns1:ManufactureToOrderInd.description: Identifies a Supply facility that manufactures to order and not to inventory. Used by the Undependent System to determine when to reduce the onhand figure (on SSITMQTY). Set by the Merchandising Department Manager (Empress).

ns1:MaxInitialLetdownNbr.description: This Nbr is used to control the MAX Nbr of letdown sections. It is used/compared in calculations using chkpnt, and WACMAS info. The program will use the lesser calculated value of the two for the Max letdown sections.(see EXC047)

ns1:NextWeekAdjustmentFactor.description: Allows the forcast and MAD to be adjusted. Used when the delivery date falls within next week. This us used by WMD510. The default value is 1.0. It is set by the Merchandising Department Manager.

ns1:OldDistributionCenterCd.description: Cd used to identify a distribution center by systems before the Merchandising system was implemented.  Also see LEGACY element MCL-BR.

items.description: Generic type to capture different org structures.

ns1:OrgMasterFacilityId.description: Facility ID that connects to OM structure and Warehouse Ids.

ns1:POArrivalDays.description: If a Purchase Order arrival date is within theis Nbr of days of the start of a deal, it will be reported on the P.O. Arrivals vs Pending Deals Report. Used by WMD560. Default value is 7. Set by the Merchandising Department Manager.

ns1:PalletCubingInd.description: This option allows the user to request pallet cubing to be performed for the warehouse. If this is set to Y then the pallet rounding switch is checked plus the upper/lower pallet limits (EXSTNOPT). IF the CALM system is used for this warehouse (WRKASMTSELSW or WRKASMTLTDSW = Y) then this switch must be set to Y

ns1:PalletLineCost.description: Used to control the Nbr of pallets ordered. Increasing this Amt could cause an item to order a higher pallet when only one is needed. Used by WMD510. Default value is 1.75. The Merchnadising Department Manager set this value.

ns1:PalletRoundingLowerLimitNbr.description: If the fraction of the remaining pallet is less than this value, then the order is rounded down to the Nbr of full pallets.

ns1:PalletRoundingOptionInd.description: Used to indicate if pallet rounding is to be performed for this warehouse.

ns1:PalletRoundingUpperLimitNbr.description: If the fraction of the remaining pallet is greater than this value, then the order is rounded up to the Nbr of full pallets.

ns1:PalletThresholdInd.description: This field is used by program EXC021 and controls whether added pallets from the EXPRES Order Header are checked in Units (U) or by Percentage (P).

ns1:PalletThresholdNbr.description: This is the value that the Added Pallets from the EXPRES order header is tested against to decide whether the added pallets will create a positive or negative change to an order. Program EXC021 uses this field.

ns1:PercentCompleteInd.description: Used to determine if percent complete calculations will be used by Canadian warehouses when printing manually batched letdowns. This will allow more efficient use of warehouse resources because the calculations cannot take into account the receipt of unscheduled orders.

ns1:PhysicalInventoryInd.description: This is used to indicate if the specified warehouse is performing a physical inventory. This is used when the warehouse is taking an inventory. If data to be submitted to SSD001 should not be reflected in the inventory count, this Ind must not be set to Y. This Ind will only effect orders, receivings, receiving adjustments and inventory adjustments. If the warehouse wants to accumulate orders, receivings, receiving adjustments and inventory adjustments on the Qty field then this Ind must be Y. Note that in a non-physical inventory environment, the on-hand field is updated rather than the physical inventory Qty field. If this is set to N and the warehouse is NOT a warehouse on inventory, the physical inventory Qty is set to zero by SSD009.

ns1:PhysicalWarehouseGroupId.description: This is used by the Tandem DCMCS system for the purpose of grouping together logical warehouses for processing (inventory reduction, selection list processing, bombing and printing of selection lists).

ns1:PickorDeliveryInd.description: This Ind is used by program EXC046. It indicates whether a facility should be using the pick date or delivery date for EXC046 processing. Typically a plant, such as Van Milk, Wpg Bakery or Cgy Bakery, would have this set to a D.

ns1:PostOfficeBox.description: This is the post office box address.

ns1:PrintHazerdousGoodsPhoneNbr.description: This switch is used to control the printing of the Hazerdous Goods phone Nbr on the hazerdous goods report. The hazardous goods phone Nbr was the trucking departments phone Nbr. The hazerdous goods report was to be generated through EXC046 (print selection lists) but was never implemented.

ns1:PrintHazerdousGoodsReportInd.description: The switch is used to control the printing of a report containing a list of the hazerdous goods being selected. The report was to be generated through EXC046 (print selection lists) but was never implemented.

ns1:PrintInventoryCdInd.description: This switch is used to request printing the inventory Cds first on the report. ie: at the beginning of the report. This can be used for up to 10 different inventory Cds at a time. Program EXC046 uses this field.

ns1:PrintPriceLookupInd.description: This option will allow the user to request the printing of the PLU (price lookup) Cd on the store copy of the selection list output.

ns1:PrintWarehouseItemInd.description: An Ind used by host invoicing to determine the format of the printed item Cd branch item Cd or corp item Cd format. This column is required as department billing processing will be making use of the branch item Cd in the EXINVEXT file to communicate the departmentbilling item to DCD988 and beyond. DCD988 will use the branch item Cd to lookup the originating department for the ordered item.

ns1:ProductMaximumDays.description: Maximum Nbr of days the product is good for.

ns1:PromotionInterfaceInd.description: A switch that indicates whether or not to use the deal information from PACS facility as input into the outside marketing systems. It is used to determine the best possible deal for Safeway.

ns1:ProvincialTaxId.description: The provincial tax Id associated with this distribution center.

ns1:QAInspectionInd.description: The product passing thourgh this facility can undergo a Qualtiy Audit inspection.

ns1:ReceivingSheetAdvanceDays.description: This field is used to indicate the Nbr of days in advance of the Purchase Order due date the Receiving Sheet will be printed at the receiving location.

ns1:RegulationExemptGroupCds.description: This field is associated with hazardess goods. The values in this field would be considered exempt from printing on the hazardess goods shipping list. There are 3 classifications (regulation groups) that are predefined. They are: CC - consummer commodity LQ - limited Qty FR - Fully regulated

ns1:RestrictedOrderOverideInd.description: Used to indicate if orders should be processed even on restricted days for the specified warehouse.

ns1:RetailSectionPrintInd.description: Retail Section Print Switch. A switch that indicates whether the retail section should be printed for this facility when no store option overrides are present.

ns1:RetailUnitsInd.description: This is used to indicate if a warehouse requires shipments in retail pack units.

ns1:ReviewDays.description: Nbr of days reviewing forward from last run date of WIMS. Used by WMD510 to calculate Minimum Interval Factor Multiplier. Not processed if value is blank.

ns1:ScanEnabledInd.description: This Ind on WMFACOPT table allows the business to flag any warehouses that will be enabled for scanning (cases or pallets) for LOT Tracking. (SCANENABLEDIND = Y)

ns1:SealNbrmessageTxt.description: This is the text message that is printed in one of the total lines on the selection list (program EXC046). It describes where the Seal Nbr messages are on the package.

ns1:SelectionListByStoreInd.description: This switch is used to control whether or not to print the seperate selection lists in store order as opposed to the default of route Cd order. This would be with invoices that have a route Cd order of 901 or 999.

ns1:SelectionListSlotItemInd.description: This switch is used to control whether the selection list is printed in Slot or Item order.

ns1:ServerID.description: Gagnon assigned one warehouse Cd for each server. Used by the CALM system

ns1:ServiceLevelCd.description: Minimum service level desired for the Vendor; ratio of dollar value shipped to dollar value demand. This field is used by WMD510 - default value is 98.5.

ns1:ServiceLevelHighPercent.description: This is the service level percentage for the service level high segment group that an item falls into. The default value associated with the high contributors is 99.3 percent.

ns1:ServiceLevelHighSegmentPercent.description: All the valid WIMS items in a warehouse are ranked based on their contribution to the total warehouse cost of shipments This list is then broken down into 3 segnents. This is the field for the high segment. A default for this field would be 10%. In other words, 10% of the valid WIMS items for the warehouse would be considered high contributors.

ns1:ServiceLevelLowPercent.description: This is the service level percentage for the service level low segment group that an item falls into. The default value associated with the low contributors is 94.0 percent.

ns1:ServiceLevelLowSegmentPercent.description: All the valid WIMS items in a warehouse are ranked based on their contribution to the total warehouse cost of shipments This list is then broken down into 3 segnents. This is the field for the low segment. A default for this field would be 67%. In other words, 67% of the valid WIMS items for the warehouse would be considered low contributors.

ns1:ServiceLevelNormalSegmentPercent.description: All the valid WIMS items in a warehouse are ranked based on their contribution to the total warehouse cost of shipments This list is then broken down into 3 segnents. This is the field for normal segments. A default for this field would be 23%. In other words, 23% of the valid WIMS items for the warehouse would be considered normal contributors.

ns1:DataBatchNbr.description: common identifier for a group of orders wihtin a ROG/Warehouse, sometimes it can be a dept-id that groups all the orders belong to that dept. Static info at Whse/ROG level

ns1:PrimaryInd.description: Indicates the primary batch with in a ROG

ns1:ShelfLifeNbr.description: The default shelf life days used by WIMS if the shelf life on WIMSUB is missing.

items.description: The Nbr of days prior to the picking date that shipping orders will be sent to the Order Management System.

ns1:ShipTodayCalculationInd.description: This value controls how Ship Today is shown. For real-time on-hand warehouses such as those in Canada, the value S will denote that Ship Today will be used. For posted on-hand warehouses where orders are bombed before posting, C will indicate that Customer Order Qty will be used - this will suit warehouses in Eastern. T will indicate that the warehouse bombs orders after posting, and will cause Customer Order Qty Today to be used when calculating Ship Today. These are warehouses such as those in Norcal.

ns1:ShipWeightItemInd.description: Unknown. Just spaces on the data base so it may not even be used.

ns1:ShippingDockSectionInd.description: This switch only has effect if the SHPDCKMVSW is set to Y. When this switch is set on, shipping dock moves will put into a seperate section (section 0). When this switch is set off, shipping dock moves will be sorted to the top of each section it is put into.

ns1:ShippingUnitInd.description: This Ind is used when calculating the Nbr of pallets shipped. In EXC545 this Ind is used when the FOP-PALLET-CUBE-SW = N.

ns1:ShortFactor.description: Used to determine in the SSV1 is to be recalculated during a week when items were shorted. This factor is multiplied by the MAD. If the Amt shorted falls within the calculated Range the SSV1 is updated. Used by WMW740. Default is 1. Set by the Merchandising Manager.

ns1:SmoothingFactor.description: Controls the percentage of the new single smoothed value that comes from the last weeks movement. The default smoothing factor is used in WIMS forecasting if the Alpha on SSITMWDS is zero. Used by WMW740 - default value is 0.15.

ns1:SortFullPalletsInd.description: When this switch is set on, all full pallet orders for a warehouse will be sorted after the invalids for the warehouse on selection lists.

ns1:SubAltProductInd.description: Used to indicate if the Substitute and Alternate Item Cds are to be processed in a facility (warehouse). This allows a warehouse to overide all Sub and Alt processing no matter how the items are set up.

ns1:SupplyChainDataRepositoryExtractInd.description: Supply Chain Data Repository Extract Switch to indicate whether or not warehouse data (eg. receivings, adjustments, etc.) will be written to the SCDR. Valid values are Y for yes and or N for no.

ns1:SupplySalesInd.description: Identifies the facility as a Supply facility that sells to a Wholesale facility. Used by the Independent System to determine if the facility can use special Supply sales process features. Set by the Merchandising Department Manager (Empress).

ns1:SuppressBillingCostInd.description: This switch is used to control the printing of the billing cost on the selection lists.

ns1:SurplusFacilityNbr.description: The Nbr of days a regular item can be left in a facility before it is considered a Surplus item.

ns1:SurplusInvestmentNbr.description: The Nbr of days investment inventory can be held before it is considered surplus. Used be WMW720.

ns1:SurplusMinimumValueAmt.description: A dollar value. Items with surplus value less than this Amt will not be shown.

ns1:SurplusOverstockNbr.description: The Nbr of days overstock inventory can be held before it is considered surplus.

ns1:SurplusPromotionNbr.description: The Nbr of days special promotion inventory can be held before it is considered Surplus.

ns1:SurplusReplenishFactor.description: The Nbr of SSV1 multiplies before replenishment inventory can be considered surplus. Used by WMW720.

ns1:ThirdPartyChargesInd.description: Switch used to determine if third party charges (freight, duty, exchange, customs brokerage fees) should be defaulted.

ns1:TrackingSignalCnt.description: Determines whether fast smoothing is to be performed and when to change back to mormal smoothing when calculating the SSV1. A 'tracking signal trip' will set this field to '+9'. It will be decremented by 1 each time the ssv1 is recalculated. It is used by WMW740. The default is 5.

ns1:TrackingSignalResetCnt.description: The value that the Tracking Signal Counter is reset to when

ns1:TwoWeekAjustmentFactor.description: Allows the forcast and MAD to be adjusted. Used when the delivery date falls after next week. This us used by WMD510. The default value is 1.0. It is set by the Merchandising Department Manager.

ns1:UnitWeightCd.description: This value in this field indicates what type the unit weights are for the warehouse. ie: whether the weights are in kilograms (KG) or pounds (LB).

ns1:UpdatePurchaseOrderInd.description: This switch is used to indicate if the receiving location warehouse is permitted to create or update Purchase Orders.

ns1:UserouteCdInd.description: this field indicates whether or not a warehouse is required to use a route Cd schedule.

ns1:WCSSWarehouseCd.description: Warehouse Chain Store System (WCSS) facility Cd for a warehouse facility.

ns1:WarehouseAbbreviationNm.description: This is an abbreviated Nm for the warehouse facility. ie: 'GROC' = Grocery, 'FRFD' = Frozen foods, etc.

ns1:WarehouseItemIdLengthQty.description: The default length of WHITEMID (Warehouse Item Identifier) to be shown on the screen. It is used to identify exceptions to the 'old item Cd' length.

ns1:WarehouseShortNm.description: A short form of the warehouse facility Nm.

ns1:WarehouseStation99Ind.description: Used to indicate is warehouse station 99 will be forced for the specified warehouse.

ns1:WarehouseSystemInd.description: This is the Ind to identify warehouse system to be interfaced with.

ns1:WarehouseWeightUpdateInd.description: This field is used to indicate whether a warehouse is allowed to update the weight of items. This is typically used for Perishable like warehouses such as Meat and Produce where items do not come to the warehouse in a unit weight.

ns1:WeightThresholdInd.description: This field is used by program EXC021 and controls whether added weight from the EXPRES Order Header is checked in Units (U) or by Percentage (P).

ns1:WeightThresholdNbr.description: This is the value that the Added Weight from the EXPRES order header is tested against to decide whether the added weight will create a positive or negative change to an order. Program EXC021 uses this field.

AccountingOrganization.description: Component to represent the accounting or financial view of organization entities - Company, GLEntity etc. - grouped together.

GLEntityId.description:
A G/L entity is the smallest organizational unit for which individual financial statements must be drawn up according to relevant commercial law.

It is normally the primary balancing segment of the GL Account structure.  Typically, this is the owning entity for the transaction. 

Synonyms are Business Unit, Fund, G/L Company, Joint Venture, Non-Profit Association Name.

CostCenterId.description: The Cost Center is an accumulator of cost information that may be an organizational unit or area of responsibility.  It is an organization code that allows a grouping of expenses and costs.

WorkLocationGroup.description: Component to represent the internal organization entities - Corp, Div, Fac etc.- grouped together.

WarehouseId.description: Physical/Logical warehouse  in a distribution center.A Cd that identifies a logical warehouse facility or a supply facility  (plant).  Within a distribution center, any given item may exist in only  one warehouse facility. One or more logical facilities may exist in adistribution facility or within a physical location (building).                                                                           Logical warehouse (also called Wholesale Facility, Shipping Facility, or  Ordering Facility)

ROGCd.description: ROG stands for 'Retail Ordering Group', which identifies a group of stores that order ALL their items from the same set of warehouses, and are in the same retail division. The stores in the group may order from more than one distribution center. However, for any particular item, the stores will order it from the same distribution center

RetailStoreSK.description: Surrogate key for a retail store

RetailStoreId.description: Defines the unique identifier of a store facility.A facility is defined as a location that has specific physical address. It also involves real estate (land or building). It can also be a location for which property taxes are collected that may have parcels.

FirstEffectiveTm.description: The first time on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect. When the First Effective time is unknown, it should be set to a default of 00:00:00 or the lowest time value supported by the DBMS.

FirstEffectiveDt.description: The first Dt on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, First Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the First Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 01/01/0001 or the lowest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

LastEffectiveTm.description: The Lastt time on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect. When the First Effective time is unknown, it should be set to a default of 00:00:00 or the lowest time value supported by the DBMS.

LastEffectiveDt.description: The Last Dt on which a condition or a version of an object is, was, or will be in effect.  In order to simplify joins that must match a transaction record to reference data with a Dt filter, First Effective Dt should never contain null values.  When the First Effective Dt is unknown, it should be set to a default of 01/01/0001 or the lowest Dt value supported by the DBMS.

DivisionId.description: Identifies the division that is subset of a corporation and responsible for a certain type of line of business.

DistributionCenterId.description: Identiifes the distribution center within a division.

DepartmentId.description: Defines a Cd that uniquely identifies the departments based on its function.

CorporationId.description:
A legally defined business entity. In our business terms these are Safeway Incorporated and its associates
 and various holding or financial companies.  Independent stores that  our warehouses service are also recorded as corporations.
 Corporations are divided into divisions
